intro: Mitrasacme chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
